result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryant V Bullock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of a Controlled Substance (Amphetamine), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $500.00 PLUS all applicable costs and surcharges to be paid on or before 03-23-2016. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Court ordered 40 hours of community service to be completed on or before 03-23-2016.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryant V Bullock

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Proof of completion of community service hours, received and filed.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

The Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $500.00  plus all applicable costs and surcharges to be paid on or before 03-23-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
The Court ordered 40 hours of community service to be completed on or before 03-23-2016.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Bryant V Bullock in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Bryant V Bullock in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 23, Judge Grady.
AS OF 9-14-2015, CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO BRANCH 45, JUDGE HAVAS.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bryant V Bullock NOT in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock, who was previously in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case set for Status Conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited, but held pending restitution and recompense.

Defendant Bryant V Bullock in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for projected guilty plea.  Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending case in municipal court set for a motion hearing.  Defense reqeusts a status conference date after the motion hearing date.  No objection from the state.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bryant V Bullock in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Bryant V Bullock in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/10/15 @ 1:30 pm
